instructions: Open the app and tap Get Started . Zelle will request permission to make and manage phone calls and to access your device's location. According to Zelle, these permissions are there to detect unusual login activity, make the app smarter, and improve security. Enter your mobile number and tap Continue . Read and consent to the Privacy & Security agreement. Tap Continue. Begin typing the name of your bank. Tap it from the list of results. If your bank is not listed, tap Don't See Your Bank? You'll then be prompted to enter your email. Zelle will email you a verification code, which you can enter to complete the enrollment process. Tap Login to being linking your bank account to Zelle. You'll be directed to a secure browser window where you can log in to your banking platform. This will link your bank with your Zelle profile. If your bank is not partnered with Zelle, you'll be asked to enter your debit card information and to upload a photo of your debit card to the app. Agree to give Zelle access to your account for: Balances and transactions Account Details Quickpay with Zelle Enter your first name, last name, email address, and a password for your Zelle account, then tap Continue . Zelle will send a verification code to the email address you provided. Enter the code and tap Verify . Tap Continue on the confirmation screen informing you that your enrollment is complete. You'll be taken to the main page of your Zelle account, where you can send money, request money, or split a bill.

Log into the Zelle app. Tap Send . Zelle will request permission to access your contacts the first time you send a payment. Search your contacts to find the person you want to send money to. Alternatively, enter the phone number or email address of your recipient, then tap Next Step . If the Zelle app asks to access your contacts, tap Access Contacts . Enter the recipient's name and tap Confirm . Choose your bank account, then enter the amount you wish to send. Tap Review to continue. Tap Send to send the payment.
